results.title: Thomas L'imposteur = Thomas the Imposter
results.brief_description:
Thomas is a 16 year old who poses as the nephew of a general to help a princess get to Paris during World War I. She helps wounded soldiers by taking them back to her castle for medical care.

Credits: Producer, Eugene Lepicier ; director, Georges Franju ; writers, Jean Cocteau, Michel Worms, Georges Franju, Raphael Cluzel ; photography, Marcel Fradetal ; music, Georges Auric.
Cast: Emmanuelle Riva, Fabrice Rouleau, Rosy Varte, Bernard Lavalette, Jean-Roger Caussimon, Michel Vitold, Gabrielle Dorziat, Jean Marais.

results.title: Thomas Hardy: a man who noticed things
results.brief_description: A dramatised documentary about the life and loves of Thomas Hardy. Narrated by Charles Causley, the film looks at Hardy’s love for his home and family, his suffering for animals, his delight in both secular and sacred music, and his notorious love affairs. Illustrates how Hardy’s work related directly to such aspects of his life. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Thomas Edison 1847-1931
results.brief_description: Original footage and re-enactments are used to tell the story of Thomas Edison. Examines his accidental entry into telegraphy: his creation of an inventions factory; and his many inventions such as the light bulb, the alkaline battery, the electric train, the ediphone, the gramophone, and the motion picture camera.
